rComments: Bartlett taught a lot about structural inequalities in the education system, and drew from her personal experience as a researcher. Lectures are 90 minutes long, very clear and very inspirational. Midterm and test were essay questions and multiple choice based on the lecture and the few readings we had to do. Great teacher

Professor Bartlet is an incredible teacher who is able to inspire each student to take action against the many injustices and inequalities in our education system. During lectures she explains each concept in clear language allowing everyone to grasp the ideas.

Definitely take this class! It will change the way you see education and your world. She is deeply involved in her work and a fine example of what it means to be a great teacher. Her powerpoints are a bit hard to understand on their own but she explains them well. Class often ends early but always with a round of applause.

Such a great and enthusiastic professor, she keeps the topic so interesting, I've never actually been so excited to go to lecture because they were so interesting , never a dull moment in the class. Highly Recommend her

Bartlett knows her material well but the downside is that she and TA needs to be clearer about their expectations for the papers. TA is a tough grader so avoid handing in your papers to her. Class was interesting in the beginning but it started going downwards from there. The final paper was due the week before finals, which didn't help.

Really great, informative, intelligent, actually inspired me to minor in Education--a decision that has since greatly influenced what I want to do with my life after graduation. You couldn't ask for a better teacher for ED 60...if only she taught the entire course...

Amazing professor! Everyone should have her at least once. She has changed my view on education forever and has given me a reason to be the best teacher I can be in my future. I will never learn more from another professor.

She's really enthusiastic and knowledgable. Test is extremely easy if you study for at least 15 minutes. Don't really need to go to class but its definitely worth it if you want to get an A on the test.
Absolutely my favorite teacher here. So passionate about education, so smart, funny, engaging. She made Ed 60. Take her class!!

Take EDU 160. Her passion for the subject is contagious, as she opens your eyes to the world of education reform (which, by the way, is quite relevant in these tough times). She's extremely knowledgeable about the subject and is able to explain it to others who don't know a thing. She's one of those great professors you only get once in a while.

She makes the 1 hour and 45 min go by quickly with her passion for the subject and her funny side comments. Wonderful at presenting both sides of an argument. No tests, only papers. One down side, she's not as organized as I would have hoped and takes more than 2 weeks correcting papers. But TAKE HER CLASSES. You won't regret it!

She was an amazing teacher, very engaging, interesting, knowledgeable/passionate about the subject. Lectures are very organized/clear. She really inspires you to fight for what you believe in. She kept my attention captured all of every lecture. I wish she taught the entire class, not just 1/3 of it.
excellent professor! her topic was so interesting, and she is very clear about what she wants you to know for the exam/paper. also very helpful in trying to let everyone crashing the course in
I LOVE Lora!!!! She made the whole class. Lora is motivating and informative. I would take any class taught by her.

Take Ed 60 for professor Bartlett. seriously, one of the best professors at ucsc. her lectures are so clear and easy to follow because of her topic (what's wrong with the public education system) is so prevalent at this time. SO interesting and she doesn't talk to us like students, she talks to us like colleagues. the rest of ed 60 is super boring.

She's great. She's a little strict on her papers, for instance, single-spaced opposed to double-spaced, with not much time in between the papers. There's lots of readings to cover, but she does a good job at explaining it in class and helping you out.

Lora was by far one of my favorite teachers here at UCSC.  Her class was incredibly engaging (although some of the readings were bland).  She was an energetic, easygoing lecturer and I appreciated that she demanded higher order thinking skills from her students.  Truly an inspiring teacher.
